title: Apostle Spoon, ""St. Thomas" or "St. Matthew"", ca. 1661
markings: Marked on spoon bowl with Exeter town mark of mid 17th century.
inscribed: Later (probably late 18th century) engraved A. D. H. in Roman block letters engraved on handle near bowl; the back of the bowl with original pricked initials IF/F above the date 1661.
provenance: Museum purchase through gift of Joseph Holtzman and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund from S. J. Shrubsole, New York, NY
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Joseph Holtzman and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: With a long slender handle, terminating in a slightly oval bowl, the handle terminal with a cast figure of an apostle apparently holding a carpenter's square, generally associated with St. Thomas, although earlier representations of St. Matthew also showed him with such a square . Initials "A.D.H." engraved on handle, near spoon.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005
